title: Some items just seem too powerful.
body:
I am still new to the game but, I will try my best to organize and structure my argument.

{{item:3026}} Basically Revival after death. 60 armor 45 magic resist restores 30% of your health and mana when you take fatal damage. All for 2600 gold, and after its passive effect is gone, you can just sell it and get something else.

{{item:3078}} health, Mana, damage, attack damage, attack speed, tons of cool down reduction, and mobility, with two unique passives (more mobility oh, joy not like it ran off the map 15 seconds ago) and WHAT! 200% base attack damage and its active again after 1.5 seconds...Who isn't this item good for? 

{{item:3508}} 70 damage 20 critical strike chance (Basically infinity edge with three passives, One rewards you for building 30% critical hit chance  outside of this items 20% critical hit chance, which is achieved by Static Shiv, Phantom Dancer and Rapid Fire Cannon all of which are extremely common for marksman and rewards you with even more cool down reduction if that was not enough, it also restores your Mana when you critical hit, Essence Reaver existing completely removes the point of Infinity Edge.

{{item:3153}} 25 damage 40 attack speed, and 10@ life steal One passive and one active. this thing basically rewards you for auto attacking and thus gives you a lot of stolen health even with out its Slow and life steal activation the fact it even has a slow is over kill to begin with.

this is a massive game and these are just the items that stuck out to me as overly strong for the gold they are purchasable for.

I can understand your confusion over essence reaver vs infinity edge since I also had a point where I thought it was just straight out better. However I have since gotten more accustomed to the game and have learnt this is not the case and that essence reaver is an item that only works well on specific champions.

Firstly essence reaver has the benefit of giving mana and cdr to an adc. Now whilst cdr is great, for auto based adcs this benefit isn't exactly amazing, especially when items like maw, ghostblade and blackcleaver are often incorporated into a build situationally and also when many adcs take scaling cdr. Adc's aren't inherently mana inefficient like some mages, with the exception of certain champions like lucian, draven or sivir, so for most the mana back is kinda negligible since most adc's pool of mana will stay sufficient, so long as they don't try to use abilities to clear waves, as so often seen at lower elo.

On the other hand infinity edges 50% bonus crit damage has a much larger impact on total damage output than you might expect, especially when paired with static shiv and is a far stronger option if you were to try to come out on top of a trade. In the current meta, early damage on adcs is important and trades are often short and based around cooldowns, which means that whilst an essence reaver adc can trade more often than an IE one can, the IE adc will trade better during these short fights and this is worth far more so than a little extra mana sustain. Hence infinity edge is the prefered choice. It is also worth to consider that many adcs have some atk speed or crit modifiers in their kits which can let them hit strong powerspikes after just 1-2 items. In these cases, the early damage is very important in deciding who gets botlane tower first and inevitably moves into the midgame with the advantage.

I hope this explanation helps and isn't too convoluted. Essence reaver is a great item but it's more suited towards ad casters like lucian and ezreal, whereas IE is a great basic item for most adcs and is almost irreplaceable for adcs like caitlynn who have guaranteed crit, or adcs who rush static shiv like vayne.
